whySection.title: 13 Biggest benefits of meditation
whySection.subtitle: Although the research on meditation isn't as robust as nutrition or exercise there is a reason why itâ€™s been around for thousands of years. Weâ€™re just starting to get a better understanding of how beneficial it can be for many aspects of life, from disease and pain management, to sleep, to control of emotions. Here are the 13 biggest benefits of meditation. Click on each benefit for more details.

card_1.title: Better focus
card_1.description: Meditation is a practice of focusing our attention and being aware of when it drifts. This improves our focus outside our meditation session.

card_2.title: More creativity
card_2.description: Study showed that people who practiced mindful meditation performed better on a task that asked them to come up with new ideas.

card_3.title: Increased immunity
card_3.description: Relaxation and mindful meditation boosted immunity, resistance to tumours and viruses and reduced the risk of breast cancer recurrence.

card_4.title: Better memory
card_4.description: People who practiced mindful meditation were able to focus, block distractions, improve their rapid memory recall & increase their productivity.

card_5.title: Less stress
card_5.description: Mindful meditation has been shown to help people perform better under pressure, cope with situation, while feeling less stressed.

card_6.title: Less anxiety
card_6.description: Meditation helps us look at scary or upsetting thoughts, emotions and sensations rationally, with calmness, detachment and greater control.

card_7.title: More gray matter
card_7.description: More gray matter leads to emotional stability and heightened focus during daily life. Meditation also helps reduce the decline of cognitive functioning.

card_8.title: Emotional balance
card_8.description: Meditation help deal with unhealthy emotional states, traumas, neurosis and neurotic behavior that results from a tortured and traumatized ego.

card_9.title: Increased fertility
card_9.description: Women are more likely to conceive when they are relaxed. Relaxation lowers stress, that impacts sperm count and motility, and boosts male fertility.

card_10.title: Relieves irritable bowel syndrome
card_10.description: When patients suffering from irritable bowel syndrome began practising meditation 2x a day, symptoms of bloating, diarrhea and constipation improved.

card_11.title: Lowers blood pressure
card_11.description: A study at Harvard Medical School found that meditation lowered blood pressure by making the body less responsive to stress hormones.

card_12.title: Anti-inflammatory
card_12.description: Stress leads to inflammation, a state linked to heart disease, arthritis, asthma and psoriasis. Relaxation can help by switching off the stress response.

card_13.title: Calmness
card_13.description: In meditative mind, the thought is witnessed, while in an ordinary mind, the thought is the boss. In meditative mind, upsetting thought is just another thought.

howSection.title: How to meditate
howSection.subtitle: Meditation helps increase focus, stimulate creativity and decrease stress. These simple steps will help you get started. Click on each step for more details.

card_1.title: Select a location
card_1.description: Choose a comfortable place where you will not be interrupted or have distractions.

card_2.title: Get comfortable
card_2.description: Wear comfortable and loose clothing. You can also use a blanket, pillow or cushion if you want.

card_3.title: Set aside some time
card_3.description: Be easy on yourself. It is okay to start with a 5-10 minute meditation and work up from there.

card_4.title: Choose a background sound
card_4.description: Prioritize nature sounds. You can choose silence if you want.

card_5.title: Find a comfortable posture
card_5.description: You can sit on the floor or in a chair, stand, walk, or lie down. Play around with different positions.

card_6.title: Settle your mind
card_6.description: Take a moment to identify the thoughts and feelings you are having. Then switch your focus to your physical position.

card_7.title: Take some deep breaths
card_7.description: Bring your awareness to your breath. Notice each inhalation and exhalation. Taking deep breaths helps relax your mind and body.

card_8.title: Focus on the present
card_8.description: When you find your mind wandering, return to your body, to your breath and to the present moment.

card_9.title: Let your thoughts and emotions go
card_9.description: When you notice thoughts or emotions coming up, choose not to focus on them. Let them come, let them go, without judgment.
